questions.question: Senator Henry Cabot Lodge made this statement in opposition to--

choices.answer: U.S. membership in the League of Nations
U.S. entry into the Spanish-American War
a relaxation of U.S. citizenship requirements
the funding of a massive buildup of the U.S. Navy

questions.question: How did the military innovation shown in this photograph affect the course of World War I?

choices.answer: It made communication with officers on the front lines possible.
It helped transport large number of troops to the battlefield.
It helped break the stalemate of trench warfare.
It made the use of land mines obsolete.

questions.question: This World War I era poster was intended to persuade--

choices.answer: farmers to consume fewer scarce goods during the war
women to work producing war materials
people to save money during the war
people to help finance the war

questions.question: How did the Zimmermann telegram influence U.S. entry into World War I?

choices.answer: It described Romania's plan to abandon neutrality.
It announced the czar's overthrow in Russia.
It contained order from German U-boats to destroy British passenger ships.
It revealed a proposed military alliance between Mexico and Germany

questions.question: Which pull factor contributed to the Great Migration?

choices.answer: The availability of land grants for homesteaders
Economic opportunities in industrialized cities
The lower cost of living in urban areas
Better soil conditions in previously uncultivated areas

questions.question: This law demonstrates that at one time the federal government was willing to--

choices.answer: force people into internment camps
confiscate privately owned weapons
suspend freedom of speech
suspend habeas corpus

questions.question: The primary reason Henry Cabot Lodge and others opposed the Treaty of Versailles was--

choices.answer: the U.S. could be pulled into conflicts without congressional approval
the Panama Canal would come under international supervision
American international trading partnerships would be limited
the U.S. could be pulled into conflicts without congressional approval

questions.question: What was a primary purpose of the program being promoted by this poster?

choices.answer: To increase the food supply during farm labor shortage
To reduce health problems among working women
To encourage women to join the workforce
To promote the purchase of organically grown produce

questions.question: Which action completes this diagram?

choices.answer: Armored tanks crossed fortified lines
Submarines attacked unarmed ships
Airplanes conducted reconnaissance missions
The use of machine guns resulted in massive casualties

questions.question: Why did the United States decide to enter World War I?

choices.answer: A European nation had taken aggressive actions against the United States
The United States had suffered economically from European sanctions
The U.S. president was obligated to fulfill election campaign promises
Communist activities among U.S. immigrants were threatening the country

questions.question: What caused the scene described in this excerpt?

choices.answer: An aerial bombing of an infantry unit
A poison gas attack on soldiers in the trenches
A tank attacking soldiers on a battlefield
A submarine attacking a docked ship

questions.question: The Fourteen Points reflected President Woodrow Wilson's belief that--

choices.answer: intervention in the affairs of other nations was never justifiable
no country should be allowed to spend more on defense than other countries
cooperation among international leaders was needed to keeping world peace
travel among nations should be regulated by an international organization

questions.question: One reason this provision was included in the Treaty of Versailles was to--

choices.answer: divide Germany into smaller states to be governed by Allied countries
grant independence to all German colonies
create a democratic government in Germany
weaken the power of Germany in the international community

questions.question: General John J. Pershing contributed to the Allied victory in World War I by--

choices.answer: negotiating the terms of the Treaty of Versailles
developing advanced technologies for battlefield use
requesting humanitarian aid from Congress for war-torn countries
transforming inexperienced troops into an effective military force

questions.question: Which of the following is the best title for this list?

choices.answer: Consequences of 20th century European isolationism
Issues contributing to the outbreak of World War I
Principal reasons for U.S. entry into World War I
Economic rivalries between Cold War Superpowers

questions.question: This photo shows a military tactic that--

choices.answer: made frontal assaults difficult, resulting in long periods of stalemate
required the ability to attack quickly, resulting in a reliance on cavalry
required highly skilled soldiers, resulting in length training periods
made troops vulnerable to long-range missiles, resulting in many deaths

questions.question: Upon entering World War I, the United States enlarged its military by--

choices.answer: enacting the GI Bill
passing the Selective Service Act
creating the Veterans Administration
establishing the Marine Corps

questions.question: Which of the causes underlying World War I was this provision of the Fourteen Points intended to prevent?

choices.answer: Blockades and unrestricted submarine warfare
Nationalism and militarism
Secret treaties and alliances
Imperialism and self-determination

questions.question: What was one result of the events reported in the excerpt above?

choices.answer: Germany financed the Mexican army's attempted invasion of the U.S.
The U.S. government boycotted goods imported from Europe.
The U.S. government abandoned its official policy of neutrality.
Germany's navy blockaded several Mexican seaports

questions.question: The 1917 poster depicts a worker in a shipyard. This poster could be used to support which assertion?

choices.answer: Standardization of parts helped streamline the production of munitions.
Conscription caused a shortage of laborers during wartime.
Demand for labor in war industries helped increase employment.
Use of new war technologies required extensive training.

questions.question: The cartoon depicts President Woodrow Wilson calling on Congress to--

choices.answer: ratify the Treaty of Versailles
issue a declaration of war against Germany
authorize the use of funds to support Russian revolutionaries
enact trade sanctions against Germany

questions.question: What was the purpose of this type of Office of War Information poster?

choices.answer: To provide jobs to unemployed artists during an economic crisis
To encourage young men to join the war effort
To protect civil liberties during times of national emergency
To help the public understand its role in national security

questions.question: Which action was an immediate consequence of the event described in this headline?

choices.answer: Austrian-Hungary declared war on Serbia
Great Britain intercepted the Zimmermann telegram
The United States refused to join the League of Nations
The Russian monarchy was overthrown

questions.question: One reason for the tension between the European powers was their intense pride in their homelands, called--

choices.answer: imperialism
nationalism
progressivism
socialism

questions.question: According to the Zimmermann telegram, if Mexico allied with Germany, Germany would --

choices.answer: help Mexico regain Texas, New Mexico, and Arizona
help Mexico take control of Central America
prevent the U.S. from taking control of Mexico
send troops to support the Huerta government

questions.question: In World War I, the Central Powers included--

choices.answer: Britain and France
Britain and the United States
Germany and Austria-Hungary
Germany and Russia

questions.question: To save energy, the Fuel Administration shortened workweeks for factories that didn't make war materials & introduced--

choices.answer: conscription
daylight savings time
flexible hours
time zones

questions.question: In the case Schenck v. United States, the Supreme Court ruled that--

choices.answer: freedom of speech could be limited during wartime
immigrants from our enemy countries couldn't hold political office
the right to bear arms could be limited
the Sedition Act was unconstitutional

questions.question: During World War I, women officially served in the armed forces for the first time in--

choices.answer: combat positions.
training operation positions.
officer and management positions.
clerical and nursing positions.

questions.question: President Wilson called for the creation of a "general association of nations" known as the--

choices.answer: allies
Central Powers
League of Nations
United Nations

questions.question: In World War I, _____________ were battles in the air between planes attached with machine guns.

choices.answer: dogfights
dirigibles
trench warfare
zeppelins

questions.question: In November 1917, Vladimir Lenin's Bolshevik Party seized power in Russia and established a --

choices.answer: democratic government
monarchy
Communist government
temporary government

questions.question: The primary goal of the Dawes Act was to--

choices.answer: assimilate Native Americans
turn American Indian reservations into corporate farmland
end warfare between Indians and the U.S. military
promote American Indian investment in private industry

questions.question: The Supreme Court case of Plessy v. Ferguson, the Court ruled that--

choices.answer: that child labor was constitutional
corporations were protected by the 14th amendment
that employers could prevent labor unions from organizing
racial segregation was legal
